mtu.title: MTU
mtu.description: Maximum transmission unit (MTU) is the size of the largest IP packet that can be transmitted on this network.

private_google_access.title: Private Google Access
private_google_access.description: Private Google Access for is an alternative to connecting to Google APIs and services over the internet. Setting this to PRIVATE or RESTRICTED will deploy the required Cloud DNS and Routing functionality to enable this feature.

oneOf.title: Disabled
oneOf.description: Does not deploy GCP configuration required for Private Google Access

oneOf.title: Private
oneOf.description: Enables API access to most Google APIs and services regardless of whether they are supported by VPC Service Controls.

oneOf.title: Restricted
oneOf.description: Provides access to Cloud and Developer APIs that support VPC Service Controls. Blocks access to Google APIs and services that do not support VPC Service Controls.

private_service_connection.title: Private Service Connection
private_service_connection.description: Allows private consumption of services across VPC networks that belong to different groups, teams, projects, or organizations

allOf.title: IP CIDR Range
allOf.description: WORD WORDS WORDS - IP CIDR RANGE - WORDS WORDS WORDS

export_custom_routes.title: Export Custom Routes
export_custom_routes.description: If true, the network will export custom routes to peer network.

import_custom_routes.title: Import Custom Routes
import_custom_routes.description: If true, the network will import custom routes from peer network.

ip_cidr_range.title: IP CIDR Range
ip_cidr_range.description: IP space allocated to this subnetwork in CIDR format.

allOf.title: IP CIDR Prefix
allOf.description: WORD WORDS WORDS - IP CIDR PREFIX - WORDS WORDS WORDS

export_custom_routes.title: Export Custom Routes
export_custom_routes.description: If true, the network will export custom routes to peer network.

import_custom_routes.title: Import Custom Routes
import_custom_routes.description: If true, the network will import custom routes from peer network.

ip_cidr_prefix.title: IP CIDR PRefix
ip_cidr_prefix.description: IP CIDR prefix used for this connection. Google will automtically allocated a IP CIDR Range based on the provided prefix

routing_mode.title: Routing Mode
routing_mode.description: The BGP routing mode for this network.

oneOf.title: Global
oneOf.description: Cloud Routers in this network advertise subnetworks from all regions to their BGP peers, and program instances in all regions with the router's best learned BGP routes.

oneOf.title: Regional
oneOf.description: Cloud Routers in this network advertise subnetworks from their local region only to their BGP peers, and program instances in their local region only with the router's best learned BGP routes.

allOf.title: Private
allOf.description: A subnetwork with purpose set to PRIVATE is a user-created subnetwork that is reserved for Google Compute Engine instances.

name.title: Name
name.description: if this field is not provided ip_cidr_range value will be dynamically generated based on the ip_cidr_range. WARNING, if this field is not set changing the ip_cidr_range will change the name dynamically generated.

ip_cidr_range.title: Primary CIDR Range
ip_cidr_range.description: IP space allocated to this subnetwork in CIDR format.

secondary_subnetworks.title: Secondary Subnetworks
secondary_subnetworks.description: Collection of Secondary Subnetworks that are assigned to this Primary Subnetwokr

name.title: Name
name.description: if this field is not provided ip_cidr_range value will be dynamically generated based on the ip_cidr_range. WARNING, if this field is not set changing the ip_cidr_range will change the name dynamically generated.

nat_group_id.title: Nat Group ID
nat_group_id.description: Cloud Nat configuration ID to inherrit configruations from.

ip_cidr_range.title: Secondary CIDR Range
ip_cidr_range.description: IP space allocated to this subnetwork in CIDR format.

private_ip_google_access.title: Private IP Google Access
private_ip_google_access.description: Provide access to Google Cloud APIs from this subnet for instances without a public ip address.

log_config.title: Log Config
log_config.description: Denotes the logging options for the subnetwork flow logs. If logging is enabled logs will be exported to Stackdriver.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Configures whether metadata fields should be added to the reported logs.

oneOf.title: Include All Metadata
oneOf.description: Include all metadata in VPC flow logs

oneOf.title: Exclude All Metadata
oneOf.description: Exclude all metadata in VPC flow logs

oneOf.title: Custom Metadata
oneOf.description: Include only specific attributes for metadata in VPC flow logs

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Enable/disable VPC Flow Logs for this subnet.

aggregation_interval.title: Aggregation Interval
aggregation_interval.description: Toggles the aggregation interval for collecting flow logs. Increasing the interval time will reduce the amount of generated flow logs for long lasting connections.

flow_sampling.title: Flow Sampling
flow_sampling.description: Set the sampling rate of VPC flow logs within the subnetwork where 100 means all collected logs are reported, 50 means half of all collected logs are reported and 0 means no logs are reported.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Configures whether metadata fields should be added to the reported logs.

oneOf.title: Include All Metadata
oneOf.description: Include all metadata in VPC flow logs

oneOf.title: Exclude All Metadata
oneOf.description: Exclude all metadata in VPC flow logs

oneOf.title: Custom Metadata
oneOf.description: Include only specific attributes for metadata in VPC flow logs

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Enable/disable VPC Flow Logs for this subnet.

aggregation_interval.title: Aggregation Interval
aggregation_interval.description: Toggles the aggregation interval for collecting flow logs. Increasing the interval time will reduce the amount of generated flow logs for long lasting connections.

flow_sampling.title: Flow Sampling
flow_sampling.description: Set the sampling rate of VPC flow logs within the subnetwork where 100 means all collected logs are reported, 50 means half of all collected logs are reported and 0 means no logs are reported.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Configures whether metadata fields should be added to the reported logs.

oneOf.title: Include All Metadata
oneOf.description: Include all metadata in VPC flow logs

oneOf.title: Exclude All Metadata
oneOf.description: Exclude all metadata in VPC flow logs

oneOf.title: Custom Metadata
oneOf.description: Include only specific attributes for metadata in VPC flow logs

metadata_fields.title: Metadata Fields
metadata_fields.description: List of supported fields can be found at https://cloud.google.com/vpc/docs/flow-logs#record_format

anyOf.title: connection
anyOf.description: 5-Tuple describing this connection.

anyOf.title: connection.src_ip
anyOf.description: Connection Source IP address

anyOf.title: connection.src_port
anyOf.description: Connection Source port

anyOf.title: connection.dest_ip
anyOf.description: Connection Destination IP address

anyOf.title: connection.dest_port
anyOf.description: Connection Destination Port

anyOf.title: connection.protocol
anyOf.description: Connection IANA protocol number

anyOf.title: start_time
anyOf.description: Timestamp (RFC 3339 date string format) of the first observed packet during the aggregated time interval.

anyOf.title: end_time
anyOf.description: Timestamp (RFC 3339 date string format) of the last observed packet during the aggregated time interval

anyOf.title: bytes_sent
anyOf.description: Amount of bytes sent from the source to the destination

anyOf.title: packets_sent
anyOf.description: Number of packets sent from the source to the destination

anyOf.title: rtt_msec
anyOf.description: Latency as measured during the time interval, for TCP flows only. The measured latency is the time elapsed between sending a SEQ and receiving a corresponding ACK. The latency result is the sum of the network RTT and any time consumed by the application

anyOf.title: reporter
anyOf.description: The side which reported the flow. Can be either SRC or DEST.

anyOf.title: src_instance
anyOf.description: If the source of the connection was a VM located on the same VPC, this field is populated with VM instance details. In a Shared VPC configuration, project_id corresponds to the project that owns the instance, usually the service project.

anyOf.title: src_instance.project_id
anyOf.description: ID of the project containing the VM

anyOf.title: src_instance.vm_name
anyOf.description: Instance name of the VM

anyOf.title: src_instance.region
anyOf.description: Region of the VM

anyOf.title: src_instance.zone
anyOf.description: Zone of the VM

anyOf.title: dest_instance
anyOf.description: If the destination of the connection was a VM located on the same VPC, this field is populated with VM instance details. In a Shared VPC configuration, project_id corresponds to the project that owns the instance, usually the service project.

anyOf.title: dest_instance.project_id
anyOf.description: ID of the project containing the VM

anyOf.title: dest_instance.vm_name
anyOf.description: Instance name of the VM

anyOf.title: dest_instance.region
anyOf.description: Region of the VM

anyOf.title: dest_instance.zone
anyOf.description: Zone of the VM

anyOf.title: src_vpc
anyOf.description: If the source of the connection was a VM located on the same VPC, this field is populated with VPC network details. In a Shared VPC configuration, project_id corresponds to that of the host project.

anyOf.title: src_vpc.project_id
anyOf.description: ID of the project containing the VPC

anyOf.title: src_vpc.vpc_name
anyOf.description: VPC on which the VM is operating

anyOf.title: src_vpc.subnetwork_name
anyOf.description: Subnetwork on which the VM is operating

anyOf.title: dest_vpc
anyOf.description: If the destination of the connection was a VM located on the same VPC, this field is populated with VPC network details. In a Shared VPC configuration, project_id corresponds to that of the host project.

anyOf.title: dest_vpc.project_id
anyOf.description: ID of the project containing the VPC

anyOf.title: dest_vpc.vpc_name
anyOf.description: VPC on which the VM is operating

anyOf.title: dest_vpc.subnetwork_name
anyOf.description: Subnetwork on which the VM is operating

anyOf.title: src_location
anyOf.description: If the source of the connection was external to the VPC, this field is populated with available location metadata.

anyOf.title: src_location.continent
anyOf.description: Continent for external endpoints

anyOf.title: src_location.country
anyOf.description: Country for external endpoints, represented as ISO 3166-1 Alpha-3 country codes.

anyOf.title: src_location.region
anyOf.description: Region for external endpoints

anyOf.title: src_location.city
anyOf.description: City for external endpoints

anyOf.title: src_location.asn
anyOf.description: The autonomous system number (ASN) of the external network to which this endpoint belongs.

anyOf.title: dest_location
anyOf.description: If the destination of the connection was external to the VPC, this field is populated with available location metadata.

anyOf.title: dest_location.continent
anyOf.description: Continent for external endpoints

anyOf.title: dest_location.country
anyOf.description: Country for external endpoints, represented as ISO 3166-1 Alpha-3 country codes.

anyOf.title: dest_location.region
anyOf.description: Region for external endpoints

anyOf.title: dest_location.city
anyOf.description: City for external endpoints

anyOf.title: dest_location.asn
anyOf.description: The autonomous system number (ASN) of the external network to which this endpoint belongs.

anyOf.title: src_gke_details
anyOf.description: GKE metadata for source endpoints. Only available if the endpoint is GKE.

anyOf.title: src_gke_details.cluster
anyOf.description: GKE cluster metadata.

anyOf.title: src_gke_details.cluster.cluster_name
anyOf.description: GKE cluster name.

anyOf.title: src_gke_details.cluster.cluster_location
anyOf.description: Location of the cluster. This can be a zone or a region depending if the cluster is zonal or regional.

anyOf.title: src_gke_details.pod
anyOf.description: GKE Pod metadata, populated when the source or destination of the traffic is a Pod.

anyOf.title: src_gke_details.pod.pod_name
anyOf.description: Name of the Pod.

anyOf.title: src_gke_details.pod.pod_namespace
anyOf.description: Namespace of the Pod.

anyOf.title: src_gke_details.service
anyOf.description: GKE Service metadata, populated in Service endpoints only. The record contains up to two Services. If there are more than two relevant Services, this field contains a single Service with a special MANY_SERVICES marker.

anyOf.title: src_gke_details.service.service_name
anyOf.description: Name of the Service. If there are more than two relevant Services, the field is set to a special MANY_SERVICES marker.

anyOf.title: src_gke_details.service.service_namespace
anyOf.description: Namespace of the Service.

anyOf.title: dest_gke_details
anyOf.description: GKE metadata for destination endpoints. Only available if the endpoint is GKE.

anyOf.title: dest_gke_details.cluster
anyOf.description: GKE cluster metadata.

anyOf.title: dest_gke_details.cluster.cluster_name
anyOf.description: GKE cluster name.

anyOf.title: dest_gke_details.cluster.cluster_location
anyOf.description: Location of the cluster. This can be a zone or a region depending if the cluster is zonal or regional.

anyOf.title: dest_gke_details.pod
anyOf.description: GKE Pod metadata, populated when the source or destination of the traffic is a Pod.

anyOf.title: dest_gke_details.pod.pod_name
anyOf.description: Name of the Pod.

anyOf.title: dest_gke_details.pod.pod_namespace
anyOf.description: Namespace of the Pod.

anyOf.title: dest_gke_details.service
anyOf.description: GKE Service metadata, populated in Service endpoints only. The record contains up to two Services. If there are more than two relevant Services, this field contains a single Service with a special MANY_SERVICES marker.

anyOf.title: dest_gke_details.service.service_name
anyOf.description: Name of the Service. If there are more than two relevant Services, the field is set to a special MANY_SERVICES marker.

anyOf.title: dest_gke_details.service.service_namespace
anyOf.description: Namespace of the Service.

cloud_nat.title: Cloud Nat
cloud_nat.description: This section specifies how Primary and Secondary Subnetworks should be configured to NAT egress traffic.

subnetworks_to_nat.title: Subnetworks to NAT
subnetworks_to_nat.description:
Used to determine if NAT should be applied to either Primary, Secondary or Combination of each Subnetworks
    This section is only implemented if subnetworks_to_nat is set to SELECTED_PRIMARY_SUBNETWORKS_SELECTED_SECONDARY_SUBNETWORKS in the parent cloud_nat section.

oneOf.title: Disabled
oneOf.description:
Cloud NAT should not be applied to either the primary or secondary subnetworks.
    This does not override cloud_nat configurations in the parent object when set to ALL_PRIMARY_SUBNETWORKS_ALL_SECONDARY_SUBNETWORKS.

oneOf.title: Primary and All Secondary Subnetworks
oneOf.description: Cloud NAT Should be applied to the Primary and All Secondary Subnetworks.

oneOf.title: Primary Subnetwork
oneOf.description: Cloud NAT Should be applied to the Primary Subnetwork.

oneOf.title: Primary Subnetwork and Selected Secondary Subnetworks
oneOf.description: Cloud NAT Should be applied to the Primary and Selected Secondary Subnetworks.

oneOf.title: All Secondary Subnetworks
oneOf.description: Cloud NAT Should be applied to All Secondary Subnetworks.

oneOf.title: Selected Secondary Subnetworks
oneOf.description: Cloud NAT Should be applied to Selected Secondary Subnetworks.

nat_group_id.title: Nat Group ID
nat_group_id.description: This ID is used to match the corresponding cloud nat configuration in the parent object.

allOf.title: Private Service Connect
allOf.description: A subnetwork with purpose set to PRIVATE_SERVICE_CONNECT is a user-created subnetwork that is reserved for Private Service Connect Internal Load Balancing.

name.title: Name
name.description: if this field is not provided ip_cidr_range value will be dynamically generated based on the ip_cidr_range. WARNING, if this field is not set changing the ip_cidr_range will change the name dynamically generated.

ip_cidr_range.title: Primary CIDR Range
ip_cidr_range.description: IP space allocated to this subnetwork in CIDR format.

allOf.title: Internal HTTP(s) Load Balancer
allOf.description: A subnetwork with purpose set to INTERNAL_HTTPS_LOAD_BALANCER is a user-created subnetwork that is reserved for Internal HTTP(S) Load Balancing.

name.title: Name
name.description: if this field is not provided ip_cidr_range value will be dynamically generated based on the ip_cidr_range. WARNING, if this field is not set changing the ip_cidr_range will change the name dynamically generated.

ip_cidr_range.title: Primary CIDR Range
ip_cidr_range.description: IP space allocated to this subnetwork in CIDR format.

allOf.title: All Primary and Secondary Subnetworks
allOf.description: Automatically nat all egress traffic from all primary and secondary subnetworks in this network

endpoint_independent_mapping.title: Endpoint Independent Mapping
endpoint_independent_mapping.description: Enable endpoint-independent mapping for the NAT (as defined in RFC 5128).

log_config.description: Enable logging for the NAT. Logs will be exported to Stackdriver.

min_ports_per_vm.description: Minimum number of ports allocated to a VM from this NAT.

udp_idle_timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for UDP connections.

icmp_idle_timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for ICMP connections.

tcp_established_idle_timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for TCP established connections.

tcp_transitory_idle_timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for TCP transitory connections.

allOf.title: All Primary Subnetworks
allOf.description: Automatically nat all egress traffic from all primary subnetworks in this network

endpoint_independent_mapping.title: Endpoint Independent Mapping
endpoint_independent_mapping.description: Enable endpoint-independent mapping for the NAT (as defined in RFC 5128).

log_config.description: Enable logging for the NAT. Logs will be exported to Stackdriver.

min_ports_per_vm.description: Minimum number of ports allocated to a VM from this NAT.

udp_idle_timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for UDP connections.

icmp_idle_timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for ICMP connections.

tcp_established_idle_timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for TCP established connections.

tcp_transitory_idle_timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for TCP transitory connections.

allOf.title: Selected Primary Subnetworks and Selected Secondary Subnetworks
allOf.description: Allows you to select specific primary and secondary subnetworks to nat based on nat_group_id

endpoint_independent_mapping.title: Endpoint Independent Mapping
endpoint_independent_mapping.description: Enable endpoint-independent mapping for the NAT (as defined in RFC 5128).

log_config.description: Enable logging for the NAT. Logs will be exported to Stackdriver.

min_ports_per_vm.description: Minimum number of ports allocated to a VM from this NAT.

udp_idle_timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for UDP connections.

icmp_idle_timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for ICMP connections.

tcp_established_idle_timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for TCP established connections.

tcp_transitory_idle_timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for TCP transitory connections.

allOf.title: [DISABLED] All Primary and Secondary Sub
allOf.description: Disabled placeholder for GENERIC cloud nat, when DISABLED nothing is configured within GCP

peers.title: VPC Network Peers
peers.description: Collection of VPC Peers that enables you to connect VPC networks so that workloads in different VPC networks can communicate internally.

project.title: Project
project.description: The name of the project for the peer network. If not specified, defaults to current project.

network.title: Peer Network
network.description: The name of the network to be peered with the current network.

export_custom_routes.title: Export Custom Routes
export_custom_routes.description: If true, the network will export custom routes to peer network.

import_custom_routes.title: Import Custom Routes
import_custom_routes.description: If true, the network will import custom routes from peer network.

import_subnet_routes_with_public_ip.title: Import Subnet Routes with Public IP Addresses
import_subnet_routes_with_public_ip.description: If true, the network will import subnet routes with addresses in the public IP ranges from peer network.

export_subnet_routes_with_public_ip.title: Export Subnet Routes with Public IP Addresses
export_subnet_routes_with_public_ip.description: If true, the network will export subnet routes with addresses in the public IP ranges from peer network.

next_hop_type.description: The type of route to be created.

name.title: Name
name.description: if this field is not provided name value will be dynamically generated.

description.description: An optional, textual description for the route.

destination.title: Destination CIDR Range
destination.description: The destination range of outgoing packets that the route will apply to.

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: Specifies the priority of this route relative to other routes with the same specificity. The lower the value, the higher the priority.

tags.title: Network Tags
tags.description: Identifies the set of instances that this route will apply to. If no tags are provided, the route will apply to all instances in the network.

items.title: Tag
items.description: Strings added to a tags field in a resource, such as Compute Engine virtual machine (VM) instances or instance templates. Tags enable you to make firewall rules and routes applicable to specific VM instances.

next_hop_type.description: The type of route to be created.

next_hop_load_balancer_id.description: Target Load Balancer that traffic should be routed to. Expected format is projects/<project_id>/regions/<region>/forwardingRules/<resource_id>
